data.name: UseLiteralsWhereAppropriateTitle
data.value: Use literals where appropriate

data.name: UseLiteralsWhereAppropriateDescription
data.value: A field is declared static and read-only (Shared and ReadOnly in Visual Basic), and is initialized by using a value that is computable at compile time. Because the value that is assigned to the targeted field is computable at compile time, change the declaration to a const (Const in Visual Basic) field so that the value is computed at compile time instead of at run?time.

data.name: UseLiteralsWhereAppropriateMessageDefault
data.value: Field {0} is declared as 'static readonly' but is initialized with a constant value '{1}'. Mark this field as 'const' instead.

data.name: UseLiteralsWhereAppropriateMessageEmptyString
data.value: Field {0} is declared as 'static readonly' but is initialized with an empty string (""). Mark this field as 'const' instead.

data.name: DoNotInitializeUnnecessarilyTitle
data.value: Do not initialize unnecessarily

data.name: DoNotInitializeUnnecessarilyDescription
data.value: The common language runtime initializes all fields to their default values before running the constructor. In most cases, initializing a field to its default value in a constructor is redundant, which degrades performance and adds to maintenance costs. One case where it is not redundant occurs when the constructor calls another constructor of the same class or a base class constructor and that constructor initializes the field to a non-default value. In this case, changing the value of the field back to its default value can be appropriate.

data.name: DoNotInitializeUnnecessarilyMessage
data.value: Do not initialize unnecessarily

data.name: PreferJaggedArraysOverMultidimensionalTitle
data.value: Prefer jagged arrays over multidimensional

data.name: PreferJaggedArraysOverMultidimensionalDescription
data.value: A jagged array is an array whose elements are arrays. The arrays that make up the elements can be of different sizes, leading to less wasted space for some sets of data.

data.name: PreferJaggedArraysOverMultidimensionalMessageDefault
data.value: {0} is a multidimensional array. Replace it with a jagged array if possible.

data.name: PreferJaggedArraysOverMultidimensionalMessageReturn
data.value: {0} returns a multidimensional array of {1}. Replace it with a jagged array if possible.

data.name: PreferJaggedArraysOverMultidimensionalMessageBody
data.value: {0} uses a multidimensional array of {1}. Replace it with a jagged array if possible.

data.name: MarkMembersAsStaticTitle
data.value: Mark members as static

data.name: MarkMembersAsStaticDescription
data.value: Members that do not access instance data or call instance methods can be marked as static (Shared in Visual Basic). After you mark the methods as static, the compiler will emit nonvirtual call sites to these members. This can give you a measurable performance gain for performance-sensitive code.

data.name: MarkMembersAsStaticMessage
data.value: Mark members as static

data.name: DisposeObjectsBeforeLosingScopeTitle
data.value: Dispose Objects Before Losing Scope

data.name: DisposeObjectsBeforeLosingScopeDescription
data.value: Because an exceptional event might occur that will prevent the finalizer of an object from running, the object should be explicitly disposed before all references to it are out of scope.

data.name: DisposeObjectsBeforeLosingScopeMessage
data.value: Dispose Objects Before Losing Scope

data.name: ReviewVisibleEventHandlersTitle
data.value: Review visible event handlers

data.name: ReviewVisibleEventHandlersDescription
data.value: A public or protected event-handling method was detected. Event-handling methods should not be exposed unless absolutely necessary.

data.name: ReviewVisibleEventHandlersMessageSecurity
data.value: Consider making {0} not externally visible or ensure that it is benign code.

data.name: ReviewVisibleEventHandlersMessageDefault
data.value: Consider making {0} not externally visible.

data.name: SealMethodsThatSatisfyPrivateInterfacesTitle
data.value: Seal methods that satisfy private interfaces

data.name: SealMethodsThatSatisfyPrivateInterfacesDescription
data.value: An inheritable public type provides an overridable method implementation of an internal (Friend in Visual Basic) interface. To fix a violation of this rule, prevent the method from being overridden outside the assembly.

data.name: SealMethodsThatSatisfyPrivateInterfacesMessage
data.value: Seal methods that satisfy private interfaces

data.name: RemoveEmptyFinalizers
data.value: Remove empty Finalizers

data.name: RemoveEmptyFinalizersDescription
data.value: Finalizers should be avoided where possible, to avoid the additional performance overhead involved in tracking object lifetime.

data.name: DoNotCallOverridableMethodsInConstructors
data.value: Do not call overridable methods in constructors

data.name: DoNotCallOverridableMethodsInConstructorsDescription
data.value: Virtual methods defined on the class should not be called from constructors. If a derived class has overridden the method, the derived class version will be called (before the derived class constructor is called).

data.name: RethrowToPreserveStackDetailsMessage
data.value: Re-throwing caught exception changes stack information.

data.name: RethrowToPreserveStackDetailsTitle
data.value: Rethrow to preserve stack details.
